content: the tribble break yarn leaving a 10 inch tail match up the diagonal ends and sew them together designed by 1870 pearl sew up each side using a running stitch it could be a bath scrubbie a pot scrubber on one side use the tail that you seamed the two a frisbee or anything you like edges together on the other - the cast on tail * * * * * * finished size 4 inch circle scraps of dishcloth cotton a whopping 2/3rds of an ounce or 63 oz to be exact needles 2 us size 6 dpns or straights you can use any needle size that you like sewing needle and scissors when you have sewn both sides then pull the yarn really tight to close the circle pretend that you are cast on 18 stitches strangling something make sure you have a six inch tail or longer weave in ends and cut the yarn repeat the process on the other side commence stitch pattern note if you don t have enough yarn to knit a total row 1 knit of 10 inches go for about 8 inches in length or you could try knitting with a variety of scraps still row 2 k1 ssk k13 k1f& b k1 aiming for about 10 inches weave in the tails before you sew up the side seams repeat these two row until piece measures about 10 inches long end on row 1 cast off this is a free pattern make as many copies as you like however you may not reproduce this pattern in any publication nor can you sell it for profit without prior permission from the author http //1870pearl typepad com/ a1870pearl@yahoo com ravelry id abigail
